subject: Cybersecurity
title: SMS Codes: Convenient but Vulnerable
description: A short lesson to help you apply SMS Codes: Convenient but Vulnerable.

hook.text: That 6-digit code texted to your phone? Attackers can intercept it before it reaches you.

buildup.text: SMS-based 2FA sends a one-time code via text message. It's the most widely deployed second factor worldwide.

discovery.text: SMS travels through the SS7 network, built in the 1970s with no security. Attackers can intercept messages in transit.

twist.text: SIM swapping is easier: an attacker convinces your carrier to transfer your number to their SIM card. Now they get.

climax.text: SMS 2FA is better than no 2FA, but app-based TOTP or hardware keys are far more resistant to interception.

punchline.text: Better than nothing. But 'better than nothing' is a low bar.

quiz.question: Why is SMS-based 2FA considered vulnerable?
options: SMS travels through the insecure SS7 network and can be intercepted or SIM-swapped
